snippet: PepsiCo is trimming 3 percent of its global work force and increasing advertising and marketing to revive its North American soft drink sales.
abstract: PepsiCo outlines a plan that includes cutting thousands of jobs and increasing advertising in an effort to revive its soft drink business in North America; company reports a fourth-quarter profit of $1.42 billion, up from $1.37 billion; earnings per share rose to 89 cents, from 85 cents a share in the same quarter a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: PepsiCo is trimming 3 percent of its global work force and increasing advertising and marketing to revive its North American soft drink sales.
